duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate Nursing Services in accordance with Tennessee State Veterans’ Home Board policies and applicable state and federal laws.
Supervise and manage nursing personnel, including interviewing, hiring, training, and performance appraisal.
Set resident care standards and develop individualized care plans, including rehabilitation programs and family involvement.
Analyze Quality Indicator reports, identify concerns, and implement corrective action to improve resident care.
Develop and implement nursing rehabilitation and restorative programs.
Conduct staff meetings, resident care conferences, and initiate corrective action as necessary.
Participate in committee meetings and ensure nursing service compliance with regulations.
Demonstrate consistent management of nursing service problems, emergency situations, and initiate “life-saving” measures in the absence of a physician.

education_certification.credential: Current valid Tennessee Nursing license as a Registered Professional Nurse in good standing.
At least two years of leadership experience in Long Term Care.
